attributes.action: Call for a General Election over Proposed Mandatory Digital ID.
attributes.additional_details: Mandatory digital ID affects everyone’s rights. Announcing it without a public vote breaches democratic principles. We demand a general election so the public can decide, and call for full parliamentary scrutiny of any future digital ID proposals.
attributes.background: Introducing mandatory digital ID without asking the public is undemocratic. We demand a general election to restore accountability and ensure all future digital ID plans are fully debated in Parliament.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Call an immediate general election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727309
